articles.author: Jasper Ward
articles.description: The two Israeli embassy staffers were committed to Israel-Palestinian dialogue and about to get engaged.
articles.title: Two Israeli embassy staffers shot dead in downtown Washington, lone suspect held

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Flour and other food aid will start reaching some of Gaza's most vulnerable people after Israel let some trucks through, but nowhere near enough to make up for shortages caused by an 11-week blockade, Palestinian officials said.
articles.title: Some bread and baby food reach Gazans as blockade eases, Palestinians call for more

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) said on Thursday that Gaza's health system is at a breaking point as Israel's intensified military operations continue, amidst worsening mass population displacement and acute shortages of basic necessities.
articles.title: Gaza health system at breaking point as Israeli hostilities intensify, WHO says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States would bear legal responsibility in the event of an Israeli attack on Iranian nuclear facilities, Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Thursday, following a CNN report that Israel might be preparing strikes on Iran.
articles.title: Iran warns Israel, US against any attack on its nuclear sites

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korea has begun a full-scale investigation into the accident that occurred during the launch of a warship this week, state media KCNA reported on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea launches probe into accident during warship's launch

articles.author: James Mackenzie, Maytaal Angel
articles.description: For Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, the shooting of two young embassy staffers at a Jewish event in Washington was a horrific example of the antisemitism that has flared across the world since the Hamas-led attack on Israel on October 7, 2023.
articles.title: Netanyahu links embassy shootings to hostility over Gaza

articles.author: Christian Martinez
articles.description: At least two people were killed and eight others injured on Thursday when a small plane crashed in a San Diego neighborhood where military families lived, damaging houses and vehicles.
articles.title: Small plane crashes into San Diego neighborhood, killing at least 2

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States will impose sanctions on Sudan after determining its government used chemical weapons in 2024 during the army's conflict with the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, the State Department said on Thursday.
articles.title: US to impose sanctions on Sudan after finding government used chemical weapons

articles.author: Nate Raymond, Ted Hesson, Maria Tsvetkova, Ryan Jones, Jasper Ward, Ann Saphir
articles.description: The administration is forcing existing students to transfer to other schools or lose their legal status, while also threatening to expand the crackdown to other schools.
articles.title: Trump administration blocks Harvard's international enrollments, threatens broader crackdown

articles.author: A.J. Vicens
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Justice on Thursday unsealed charges against a Russian national accused of leading the development and deployment of malicious software that infected thousands of computers over more than a decade.
articles.title: US indicts Russian accused of ransomware attacks
